Rails Secrets & Deployment: Keeping it Secure (But Simple)

Hey there, Rails enthusiasts! Today, I want to document something I worked on a bit at office ‚Äì managing secrets in our Rails apps without pulling our hair out. üöÄ

Keeping Secrets Secret in Rails

Environment Variables

Where do we keep our secrets, aka, secret_key_base and OAuth credentials? In environment variables, of course! Here‚Äôs the drill:

Setting Environment Variables ‚Äì A Quick How-To

  • On VPS: Add them to your .bash_profile or .bashrc like so: 
    export SECRET_KEY_BASE=your_super_secret_key

  • Cloud Providers & Containers: They‚Äôve got their own fancy ways. Follow their docs, peace!

  • Heroku: Just a quick command away:

    heroku config:set SECRET_KEY_BASE=your_super_secret_key

Rails Credentials: The Secret Keeper

You can edit Rails credentials using:

rails credentials:edit

or

EDITOR="mate --wait" bin/rails credentials:edit

Rails might ask you to add the ‚Äìwait option. Apparently it is important because it makes the command line process wait for the text editor to close the file, ensuring that your changes are saved correctly before the process continues

Common Sense Practices

  • Never hardcode secrets. Like, ever.
  • Keep your circle of trust small ‚Äì limit who accesses your secrets.
  • Change your secrets regularly. It‚Äôs like changing passwords but for your app.

OAuth Plugin: Not a Secret Agent

The oauth-plugin gem is cool for OAuth stuff but not for secret_key_base. Remember to keep your OAuth keys in a safe spot too!

Wrapping Up

Okay, I‚Äôll end it here. Like I said, not a master! But little nuggets of revelations here and there can make a difference.

Stay coding, my friends! Goodnight!

Shalini

The idea began as a grand vision part of the Arcadian Initiative, but as with many initial plans, it underwent a transformation. I decided to focus on crafting a plugin with basic calendar functionality, a decision that taught me the valuable lesson of starting small and simple.

Each problem was a puzzle, demanding patience and creative problem-solving. I must also admit, I had a lot of help from geniuses lurkng about in the discord tech groups.

It‚Äôs a reminder that sometimes, stripping down an idea to its essentials can lead to a more robust and functional product.
